result.reason: Application themes do not correctly render or adapt when Windows High Contrast Mode is enabled due to an explicit override with a basic theme. This impacts accessibility.
result.approach: Modify ThemeManager.cs to ensure that when High Contrast Mode is active, the active theme is based on the currently selected theme but with its ExtendedColorPalette explicitly set to null. This allows the OS high contrast settings to take precedence for UI elements.
